item.description:

Swish 1.12

  • Added Stage Manager auto-detection and a custom offset slider for its recent apps area.
  • Synced grid spacing when â€˜Sequoia Window Tilingâ€™ is enabled.
  • Improved window detection for apps that block the Accessibility API (e.g. Adobe and Affinity).
  • Improved speed of the â€˜Minimize/Unminimize Allâ€™ menubar gesture.
  • Added Dock gesture support for apps that do not have a macOS app bundle ID.
  • Fixed a bug where windows would be re-snapped erroneously after exiting fullscreen mode.
  • Fixed a crash when interacting with unbundled symlinked applications launched via Terminal.

Swish 1.11

  • Added the option to use macOS Sequoiaâ€™s native window tiling for 2Ã—2 snapping.
  • Even smoother live tooltip animation.
  • Disabled gestures on scrollable sliders in toolbars, e.g. in Music.app.
  • Fixed a bug where Swish would crash when minimizing its own settings window.

Swish 1.10.4

  • Updated dependencies for macOS 15 (Sequoia).
  • Smoother live tooltip animation.
  • Improved compatibility with Mac Mouse Fix.

Swish 1.10.3

  • Updated dependencies for macOS 14 (Sonoma).

Swish 1.10.2

  • Support for tabs in VS Code and Orion browser, vertical tabs in Edge and Easels in Arc.
  • Fixed a bug where gestures would trigger on HTML tab elements and PDF thumbnails in Chromium browsers.
  • Improved Dock auto hide detection to prevent accidental re-snapping.
  • Fixed a bug where super modifier + Esc would trigger a Center action even with arrow hotkeys disabled.
  • Improved Accessibility permissions (no Input Monitoring popup) for new installations.

Swish 1.10

  • Stage Manager support: Activate/deactivate Stage Manager via Swish's menubarlet
  • Support for closing tabs in Arc browser.
  • Improved Launch at Login reliability on macOS 13.
  • Restored tab support for the latest version of Microsoft Edge.
  • Improved license activation reliability. Unfortunately, an activation now only counts for a single user on a machine as this was causing issues.
  • Switched to .dmg from .zip app distribution format to mitigate app translocation problems.
